reviewText: Every second of this film is made with care and deep humanity. Shot in a beautiful region of South Africa, THING WITH NO NAME tells the heart-breaking stories of Danisile and Ntombeleni, two women struggling with AIDS. Amazing cinematography, a gripping story that pulls viewers in, and a subtly elegant score make THING WITH NO NAME a must-see film for anyone interested in Africa, AIDS, and real women's lives.
